Community News, Activities, and Projects. Recent activities, announcements, current projects, and ways you can get involved with the City of Sanford. More News Sanford City Commission Unanimously Voted Not to Move Forward With the Proposed Fire Assessment fee September 9, 2025 We’re Listening Help Us Improve the Development Review Process September 4, 2025 One Lane Closure Starting September 2nd August 25, 2025 Fire Assessment Fee Vote August 25, 2025 Meet the Mayor Art Woodruff was born and raised in Sanford as a sixth generation Sanfordite. Graduating from Seminole High School in 1980 he attended the University of North Carolina and returned to Sanford where he started teaching in Seminole County Public Schools. After fourteen years at Seminole High School as a science teacher and yearbook adviser, he transferred to Oviedo High School where he currently teaches science and computer science. First elected as the District 1 Commissioner in 2001, he served through 2010. After one term off, he was again elected in November 2014. In July 2020 he was appointed Mayor following the resignation of Mayor Jeff Triplett. “I look forward to building on the many positive improvements that have taken place while serving on the City Commission and continuing to make Sanford a place where we want to live, work, and play. – Art Woodruff, Mayor Visit Historic Sanford Today Meet Your City Commissioners Sheena Britton Commissioner, District 1 Sheena.britton@sanfordfl.gov (407)688.5001 Kerry S. What We Do The Communications Office manages all aspects of the City’s communications—both online and offline. Our mission is to keep residents, stakeholders, and visitors informed and engaged through timely, accurate, and consistent messaging.We oversee: Social Media Channels The City of Sanford Website The Sanford Says Podcast Video and Visual Media Production Written Communications and Public Information Strengthening the City’s Brand We ensure that all content aligns with the City’s brand identity and messaging standards. From flyers to digital graphics, our team safeguards the consistency and professionalism of Sanford’s voice and visual presence. Community Engagement Public involvement is at the heart of what we do. Our office proudly oversees: The Citizens Academy – a hands-on opportunity to learn about city operations The Mayor’s Youth Council – developing tomorrow’s civic leaders These programs build stronger community connections and promote active civic participation. Sanford Style Guide Promoting Public Art We are also responsible for managing,  marketing and advocating for the City’s emerging Public Art Program . Through strategic promotion and community outreach, we help bring creativity and culture to public spaces across Sanford. Informing the Public Our team uses effective media relations, marketing, and outreach strategies to inform the public about: City projects and initiatives Local events and programs Public services and updates We’re here to ensure that communication is not just delivered — but received, understood, and valued. Stay Connected Explore our resources, stay up to date, and get involved. Facebook Youtube Instagram Communications & Marketing Manager Lisa Holder is the Communications & Marketing Manager for the City of Sanford. Lisa joined the City in September 2011 with several years of government relations experience. Lisa’s education includes a Bachelor of Communications Degree in Advertising from Florida International University and a Masters Degree in Public Administration from Strayer University. Lisa is the primary media contact for the City of Sanford, administers the city’s social media platforms and manages all aspects of the city’s Communication and multi-media efforts and also hosts the City’s official podcast called “Sanford Says.” Lisa is a Florida League of Cities Municipal Communicators Association, Inc. founding Board Member, a graduate of Leadership Seminole and Seminole County Public Schools’ (SCPS) Community Leadership Academy. Ms. Holder is the City of Sanford Public Art Commission staff liaison, a published writer, manages the city’s Citizens Academy and the Mayor’s Youth Council. Lisa holds a Master Social Media Certification from Splash Media U and is a Veteran, proudly serving 4 years in the United States Navy. Lisa Holder (407) 688-5019 Email: Communications & Marketing Manager Nico Durham (407) 688-5175 Email: Digital Media Specialist Sanford Photography Sanford is certainly a picturesque city. At any time you are welcome to submit your Sanford photos to the City of Sanford to be considered for use in city social media marketing, on the city website and advertising/marketing the city overall either in print, online or broadcast. Please submit your photo(s) to Communicate@sanfordfl.gov . Each photo submitted to the City of Sanford must include the Audio, Visual & Image Release and Agreement Form. Are you interested in sharing a striking photo of Sanford with your City and neighbors – – or our whole Nation and World? The City is reaching out to our residents and visitors to help find the perfect photograph of our City. From time to time, the City of Sanford receives requests from outside agencies for images of our beautiful City. If you are interested in obtaining photographs of Sanford please contact Communicate@Sanfordfl.gov or call 407-688-5019 to discuss. Photos and Video Request and Usage Not all materials appearing on this web site are in the public domain. Some materials have been donated or obtained from individuals or organizations and may be subject to restrictions on use.  You may consult City of Sanford Communications staff for details on specific items. The City of Sanford is aware of use restrictions applicable to some items or collections; however, the City of Sanford cannot confirm copyright status for any item. We recommend that you contact the United States Copyright Office at The Library of Congress to search currently copyrighted materials. Please note that because we cannot guarantee the status of specific items, you use materials found in our holdings at your own risk. Images on our web site (or a third party site where we share images and video, such as Flickr or YouTube ) are in the public domain and may be used without permission. However, you should investigate whether this image or video is, in fact, in the public domain because the City of Sanford cannot warrant or guarantee the legal status of these images or videos. If you use images or video from our site or collections, we ask that you credit the City of Sanford as the source. Please note that some images or videos on our site have been obtained from other organizations. Permission to use these images should be obtained directly from those organizations. Box 1788, Sanford, FL 32772 Apply Online Start Application Traci Houchin (407) 688-5012 Email: City Clerk COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT BLOCK GRANT (CDBG) ADVISORY BOARD The CDBG Advisory Board serves in an advisory capacity to the City Commission and City Staff to oversee an annual community needs assessment and determine funding priorities; evaluate funding proposals and make funding recommendations. Meetings are held as often as necessary. City residency is required. COMMUNITY REDEVELOPMENT AGENCY The CRA is the redevelopment agency authorized to carry out the redevelopment of the areas designated as the Lake Monroe Waterfront and Downtown Sanford Community Redevelopment Area and the Seminole Towne Center Community Redevelopment Area. Meetings are held on the 1st Wednesday of each month at 4 PM. Members must be a City resident or engaged in business within the City. Annual Statement of Financial Interest Form required for Members. FIREFIGHTERS’ RETIREMENT SYSTEM BOARD OF TRUSTEES The Board of Trustees is an independent entity established by state law and local ordinance. The Board of Trustees acts as the fiduciary of the Firefighters’ Retirement Fund, thus defraying the reasonable expenses of administering the Plan. Meetings are held on the 2nd Thursday of February, May, August and November, or more frequently as needed. City residency is required for two members appointed by the City Commission. Annual Statement of Financial Interest Form required for members. HISTORIC PRESERVATION BOARD The Historic Preservation Board oversees Sanford’s historic commercial district, which was established in 1985, and the residential historic district, which was established in 1993. The board promotes the educational, cultural, and economic welfare of the City by preserving and protecting visible reminders of the history and cultural heritage of the city, state and country as well as by encouraging new developments that will be harmonious with the existing historic area. The Board meets on the 3rd Wednesday of each month at 5:30 PM. City residency and Seminole County registered elector is required. Annual Statement of Financial Interest Form required for members. PLANNING AND ZONING COMMISSION The Planning and Zoning Commission acts as the Local Planning Agency and Land Development Regulation Commission. It recommends to the City Commission all plats, planned developments, and the boundaries of all zoning districts. The Planning and Zoning Commission reviews, and approves or disapproves, all site plans and most conditional uses. It develops and recommends all development regulations and the Comprehensive Plan. The Commission meets the 1st Thursday of each month at 10 AM. City residency and Seminole County registered elector is required. Annual Statement of Financial Interest Form required for members. POLICE OFFICERS’ RETIREMENT SYSTEM BOARD OF TRUSTEES The Board of Trustees is an independent entity established by state law and local ordinance. The Board of Trustees acts as the fiduciary of the Police Officers’ Retirement Fund, thus defraying the reasonable expenses of administering to the Plan. Meetings are held on the 2nd Thursday of February, May, August and November, or more frequently as needed. City residency is required for two members appointed by the City Commission. Annual Statement of Financial Interest Form required for members. PUBLIC ART COMMISSION The Public Art Commission is responsible for making recommendations to the City Commission regarding advocating for the program and the process and procedures that guide the acquisition and care of public art; identify and pursue additional sources of funds relative to the promotion of public art in the City; inform the public regarding public art including opportunities for public participation in all phases of the City’s public art process; promote the visual arts of the City and the State of Florida and inform and work to increase understanding within the City about the purposes and meaning of public works of art using methods such as art outreach education, media and social events. Meetings are held bi-monthly. City residency is not required. SANFORD AIRPORT AUTHORITY The Sanford Airport Authority is responsible for the Orlando-Sanford International Airport air navigation needs, and for the development, construction, operation and maintenance of the airport and related facilities, and it encourages industry to locate on the airport. Meetings are held on the 1st Tuesday of each month at 8:30 AM. Seminole County residency and registered elector is required. Annual Statement of Financial Interest Form required for members. SANFORD HOUSING AUTHORITY The Sanford Housing Authority is a public body to acquire, lease and operate housing projects; to provide for the construction, reconstruction, improvement, alteration or repair of any project; to investigate the living, dwelling and housing conditions and the means and methods of improving such conditions. Meetings are held on the 2nd Thursday of each month at 2 PM. City residency is not required. Annual Statement of Financial Interest Form required for members. The Sanford Housing Authority is an independent special district created under the provisions of controlling general law of the State of Florida. Florida Statutes Part 1 Housing Authorities, Section 421.001-421.52 SANFORD MUSEUM ADVISORY BOARD (Formerly Henry Shelton Sanford Memorial Library and Museum Board) The Sanford Museum Advisory Board is empowered and directed to recommend, on behalf of the City, ways and means of acquiring and providing for the security, safekeeping, and display of antiques, books, papers, paintings, and other similar possessions of the late General Henry Shelton Sanford, the founder of the City of Sanford, Florida, together with any other memorabilia or artifacts of historic significance to the City and the surrounding area which in the opinion of the Board would be of interest to the citizens of the City now and in the future. Meetings are held on the 1st Tuesday of January, April, July, and October at 5:15 PM. City residency and Seminole County registered elector is required. RACE, EQUALITY, EQUITY AND INCLUSION (REEI) ADVISORY COMMITTEE The REEI Advisory Committee serves in an advisory capacity to the City Commission and City staff with regard to identifying, monitoring and reviewing issues that arise in the City from time-to-time and which have historically arisen relative to the ways race, class and gender may factor into societal disparities which impact the City. The REEI Advisory Committee recommends strategies and actions that can be implemented by the City to improve how racial inequities are addressed and to improve success for all groups in the City. The REEI Advisory Committee assists the City in bringing diverse groups together in order that the City may function as a high-quality City with all members of the community working together to improve how societal inequities are addressed. The REEI Advisory Committee meets the 1st Monday of each month at 4:00 PM. *NOTE: Ethics training.   All members of each body shall, unless otherwise required to do so by controlling law, attend an ethics and Sunshine Law training session each calendar year which training session shall be coordinated by the City Clerk and the City Attorney. More News Sanford City Commission Unanimously Voted Not to Move Forward With the Proposed Fire Assessment fee September 9, 2025 We’re Listening Help Us Improve the Development Review Process September 4, 2025 One Lane Closure Starting September 2nd August 25, 2025 Fire Assessment Fee Vote August 25, 2025 Meet the Mayor Art Woodruff was born and raised in Sanford as a sixth generation Sanfordite. Graduating from Seminole High School in 1980 he attended the University of North Carolina and returned to Sanford where he started teaching in Seminole County Public Schools. After fourteen years at Seminole High School as a science teacher and yearbook adviser, he transferred to Oviedo High School where he currently teaches science and computer science. First elected as the District 1 Commissioner in 2001, he served through 2010. After one term off, he was again elected in November 2014. In July 2020 he was appointed Mayor following the resignation of Mayor Jeff Triplett. “I look forward to building on the many positive improvements that have taken place while serving on the City Commission and continuing to make Sanford a place where we want to live, work, and play. – Art Woodruff, Mayor Visit Historic Sanford Today Meet Your City Commissioners Sheena Britton Commissioner, District 1 Sheena.britton@sanfordfl.gov (407)688.5001 Kerry S. Orlando Family Events Calendar – Things to Do with Kids in Central Florida Discover the Orlando Family Events Calendar , your go-to guide for things to do with kids and families in Central Florida. From exciting Orlando festivals, family-friendly fairs, and seasonal holiday events to local story times, free community activities, and weekend fun across Orange, Seminole, Osceola, Lake, and Volusia counties, our calendar makes it easy to plan memorable outings. Whether you’re looking for kid-friendly events, indoor play, outdoor adventures, or special attractions like theme park happenings, our Central Florida events calendar Images by Blue Sunglass Photos With our Orlando Family Events Calendar , you can easily filter events by category to find exactly what fits your family’s needs. Browse holiday celebrations, free and low-cost events, back-to-school activities, seasonal festivals, and so much more. You can also filter by venue, city, cost, or even check out our featured events to quickly discover what’s happening near you. You can view listings by the day to plan their schedule, flip through different days to explore new opportunities, or switch to the monthly calendar view for a big-picture look at everything happening across Orlando and Central Florida. If you’re hosting a family-friendly event, you can even submit it directly to our calendar here . Want to have events and news deliverd to your inbox, click here to sign up for our weekly newsletters! Be sure to always double and triple check dates, times, and details of any event before heading out, as event producers may make last-minute changes without notifying us, and occasional errors may occur when loading events into the calendar. We're happy you're here! This website was designed to assist families with finding resources, ideas and things to do within the Central Florida community. We encourage all families to check and double check all events, information and news prior to making decisions for their families because, while we strive for perfection, information, news, events, and details always will and do change. Our website contains paid, non-paid, and in-trade mentions, articles, and reviews of organizations, events, schools and businesses throughout Central Florida. These mentions are for informational purposes only and should not be considered an endorsement. Please do further research on your own before choosing an event, organization, school or business to engage with. Families and individuals using our site assume all risks from any activities they participate in. MyCentralFloridaFamily.com, Epic Expos, Inc., their employees and owners are not responsible for any injuries or issues that come from participating in any of the events or opportunities listed on our website or social pages. All users/readers/visitors to MyCentralFloridaFamily.com agree to hold Epic Expos, Inc. and all of it's entities harmless in any such claims.
